Title: Maintenance and Repair of Fleet Vehicles, Plant and Taxi Testing for Solutions SK on behalf of Stockport Council
Description:
Solutions SK on behalf of Stockport Council wishes to tender its Fleet Maintenance Services. It is envisaged that Solutions SK will award the contract to one provider who will deliver the services within the boundaries of Stockport Council.

Lot 1 - Fleet Maintenance Services

Solutions SK currently has approximately 202 vehicles and Plant. The majority of these will require servicing in accordance with the service schedules set out per vehicle class. In addition to the maintenance of the Fleet is it is also expected that the successful provider will also need to service and maintain the vehicle Plant i.e. Trailers etc.
Lot 2 - Taxi Testing Services

Stockport Council (the "Council") has a statutory duty, provided by Section 50 of the Local Government (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 1976, to ensure that all private hire vehicles("PHV") and hackney carriage vehicles ("HCV") that operate within the local authorities boundaries undergo regular mechanical and bodywork compliance checks to ensure their suitability to be used as 'taxis' licensed by the Council.
The test consists of a Class IV MOT test as specified by the Vehicle and Operator Services Agency ("DVSA"), and Section 48 (of the same Act) compliance checks as specified by the Council. The combined test shall be referred to as the 'HCV/ PHV Compliance Test', 'Test' or 'Partial Re-test', in the tender documents.


Stockport Council (the "Council") has a statutory duty, provided by Section 50 of the Local Government (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 1976, to ensure that all private hire vehicles("PHV") and hackney carriage vehicles ("HCV") that operate within the local authorities boundaries undergo regular mechanical and bodywork compliance checks to ensure their suitability to be used as 'taxis' licensed by the Council.
The test consists of a Class IV MOT test as specified by the Vehicle and Operator Services Agency ("DVSA"), and Section 48 (of the same Act) compliance checks as specified by the Council. The combined test shall be referred to as the 'HCV/ PHV Compliance Test', 'Test' or 'Partial Re-test', in the tender documents.

Title: 768-17  Hire of Plant & Equipment
Description:
This framework is for the Hire of Plant & Equipment to the East Riding of Yorkshire Council. This includes but is not limited to excavators, pavers, sweepers, traffic signals, mess & welfare facilities, small plant & gardening equipment. This framework will run from 1st April 2017 - 31st March 2021. This framework is split into 8 Lots:                                                                           '768-17 - Lot A - Excavators, Dumpers, Loading Shovels, Lorries, Low Loader, Fork Lift & Trailers'
'768-17 - Lot B - Pavers, Planers, Rollers, Tractairs, Skid Steer, Chipping Spreader & Asphalt Recycler '
'768-17 - Lot C - Road Sweepers, Gully Cleaners & Jetting Equipment'
'768-17 - Lot D - Battery Traffic Signals & Radio Control Stop/Go'
'768-17 - Lot E - Mess & Welfare Facilities'

'768-17 - Lot G - Hire of Gardening Equipment'
'768-17 - Lot H - Long Term Hire of Small Plant'
'768-17 - Lot I - Mobile Elevated Work Platforms (MEWP)'

Title: For the Provision of the Operated Plant Framework 2017-2021
Description:
The Council wishes to procure a framework for the hire of a range of operated Plant to support an in house delivery model of highway maintenance. The framework will have 6 lots based on District Council boundaries as follows:
•	Lot 1 – Allerdale
•	Lot 2 – Barrow
•	Lot 3 – Carlisle
•	Lot 4 – Copeland
•	Lot 5 – Eden
•	Lot 6 – South Lakeland
Each Lot will have three sub-lots related to different categories of plant as follows:
•	Sub-lot A – Wagons
•	Sub-lot B – Tractor Loaders & Excavators
•	Sub-lot C – Road Sweepers 
Please register your interest your interest via https://www.the-chest.org.uk/ to view the tender documentation and the online questionnaire.

Title: The Supply of Self Drive Vehicle Hire - AWARD
Description:
The Supply of Self Drive Vehicle Hire

Sandwell MBC Fleet Services (“Fleet Services”) is responsible for co-ordinating vehicle hire throughout Sandwell. Fleet Services is working with the Corporate Procurement Service in order to establish a framework agreement for the provision of vehicle hire to supply a range of vehicles, including cars, vans, mini-buses, tippers and other specialist vehicles, (“Framework Agreement”) to meet the vehicle hire requirements of Sandwell MBC (the “Council”). Fleet Services invited interested suppliers (“Tenderers”) to participate in a tender exercise in relation to the Framework Agreement. 

The Council is a member of the Black Country Purchasing Consortium, which is a partnership in procurement formed between the borough councils of Dudley, Sandwell, Walsall and the city council of Wolverhampton. One of the primary objectives of the Black Country Purchasing Consortium is to establish collaborative framework agreements for the supply of goods and services that are commonly purchased across all four local authorities. It was for each individual local authority to determine if they would like to participate in / utilise each individual framework agreement.

The Framework Agreement is primarily for use by the borough councils of Sandwell, Walsall, Dudley and the city council of Wolverhampton. However, the Black Country Purchasing Consortium supports government recommendations with regards to collaborative working. As a result, the framework is available for use by any Local Authority Establishment within the West Midlands.

For the purpose of this tender exercise, at the time of advertisement the borough council of Sandwell and the city council of Wolverhampton have confirmed their intention to utilise this framework agreement. However, the borough council of Dudley and the borough council of Walsall may wish to utilise it during the term of the framework agreement.

The framework agreement will include a maximum of 5 contractors (subject to sufficient acceptable tender documents received) for each type of vehicle / hire period.
